summary: The Shetland Islands are a group of islands in Scotland, located between Orkney, the Faroe Islands, and Norway. They are the northernmost part of the United Kingdom. The islands have a long history, with humans living there since the Mesolithic period. Originally inhabited by the Picts, the Norse later conquered and settled them. Shetland has a unique culture with Norse influences, seen in festivals, music, and place names. The economy is boosted by North Sea oil and fishing. The islands are known for their native breeds, like the Shetland pony and sheepdog.
title: Shetland
